tool.name: SiteReductionTool

param.name: Training_Sites_layer
param.dialogReference: Training sites feature layer for the present model.

param.name: Thinning_Selection
param.dialogReference: Select to do thinning selection. Weights of evidence assumes there is only one training sites per unit cell. Use this option to thin, or reduce, the number of training sites to one per unit cell, which is assumed for Weights of Evidence and Logistic Regression.

param.name: Unit_Area__sq_km_
param.dialogReference: Unit area in square kilometers. Use a dot (.) as a separator for decimal values.

tool.summary:
Reduce number of training sites by random subset of sites or by thinning to one cell per unit areas. This supports the Weights of Evidence assumption that there is one training point per unit cell. Sites are first selected to be within the current mask, then selected by the selected methods.

If both site reduction methods are selected Thinning reduction is done first and followed by Random reduction to further reduce the number of sites selected.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Reduce number of training sites by random subset of sites or by thinning to one cell per unit areas. This supports the Weights of Evidence assumption that there is one training point per unit cell. Sites are first selected to be within the current mask, then selected by the selected methods.

If both site reduction methods are selected Thinning reduction is done first and followed by Random reduction to further reduce the number of sites selected.

Note! Mask must be of featureclass or featurelayer type. Raster masks are not supported!
